strengths.attribution: EXCELLENT - 53 creators with 79% ORCID coverage, clear institutional affiliations

strengths.hierarchical_organization: EXCELLENT - 6 well-documented subsets with complete metadata inheritance
strengths.standardization: STRONG - RO-Crate packaging, CC license, MIME types, MD5 checksums

weaknesses.quality_documentation: WEAK - No anomalies, biases, or limitations documented

weaknesses.use_guidance: WEAK - Only existing uses, no intended/prohibited uses beyond license

high_priority: Add download_url or explicit access instructions
Document preprocessing_strategies and software_and_tools used in data generation
Add known_limitations field discussing beta status, cell line representativeness, coverage gaps
Document intended_uses and prohibited_uses beyond license terms
Add variables field or link to data dictionaries within RO-Crate packages
medium_priority: Add version_access documentation for accessing previous versions
Include errata or changelog describing v1.0 â†’ v1.4 changes
Document subpopulations with formal cell type/treatment metadata
Add regulatory_restrictions field (even if 'None - public data')
Include related_datasets with typed relationships to PRIDE, publications, other datasets
low_priority: Consider adding ROR IDs for institutions alongside text names
Document anomalies or quality metrics from data validation
Add explicit ethics statement (e.g., 'Not applicable - cell line research only')
Include ORCIDs for remaining 11 creators without them
Add content_warnings if any cell lines derived from sensitive sources

overall_assessment.key_insight: Dataset excels at discovery, attribution, and funding transparency (elements 1, 7, 10) but lacks critical documentation for quality, limitations, and technical reproducibility (elements 4, 9). The 0% scores on ethics and limitations are concerning even for cell line research.
overall_assessment.context: GPT-5 generated comprehensive identification metadata and excellent attribution, but failed to populate fields requiring domain expertise (preprocessing, quality metrics, limitations) or fields that may be truly N/A (human subjects ethics).
overall_assessment.comparison_to_ideal: Strong foundation (discovery, funding, hierarchical structure) but needs substantial enhancement in transparency (quality, biases, limitations) and reusability (preprocessing, tools, use guidance) to meet full D4D standards.
overall_assessment.semantic_quality: MIXED - Excellent format compliance (DOIs, ORCIDs, grants, dates) and consistency across dataset/subsets, but semantic completeness limited by missing domain-specific documentation.
